pullRequest.body: I used @dwrensha's `tryAtEachStep` tool to identify many places where `simp` can finish a proof earlier, and curated a few. I especially focused on places where we can remove an `erw`.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [5ee45bab3e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20484/commits/5ee45bab3eb182784b89ec7cc19a2bbb6a94c14c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (60.00, 0.04)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1453|-60|erw|

Current commit [5ee45bab3e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/5ee45bab3eb182784b89ec7cc19a2bbb6a94c14c)
Reference commit [10a421547e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/10a421547e97c1ef37eb44e7eccfd52664072929)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9e8642f4-3450-4db3-89e7-1c6e449b622f) for commit eb5b4f3b912b0f582224523c92cde314f93e3ef8.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/22cae449-9d35-47c6-b37b-1a26fc25345c/to/9e8642f4-3450-4db3-89e7-1c6e449b622f) against commit 9837ca9d65d9de6fad1ef4381750ca688774e608:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                    Metric         Change
  ==================================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Homology.HomotopyCategory.Pretriangulated   instructions    16.7%
```

> Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9e8642f4-3450-4db3-89e7-1c6e449b622f) for commit [eb5b4f3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/eb5b4f3b912b0f582224523c92cde314f93e3ef8). There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/22cae449-9d35-47c6-b37b-1a26fc25345c/to/9e8642f4-3450-4db3-89e7-1c6e449b622f) against commit [9837ca9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/9837ca9d65d9de6fad1ef4381750ca688774e608):
> 
> ```diff
>   Benchmark                                                    Metric         Change
>   ==================================================================================
> - ~Mathlib.Algebra.Homology.HomotopyCategory.Pretriangulated   instructions    16.7%
> ```

I'm trying out a smaller change now.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5a05fe36-1485-4c54-a5e5-fa4c7e62000b) for commit 864408add8cb4bdbe3b04360889d07e3e7657634.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5ede20b2-7c25-4332-beb9-d5498c6b77ea) for commit 5ee45bab3eb182784b89ec7cc19a2bbb6a94c14c.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+
lgtm assuming this doesn't cause (big) slowdowns
